creator: seidensc@amfam.com
text:
I receive the following error trying to use the newest version of log4j (1.1.3):

log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate class [org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender].
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender

I've noticed that the source files are missing as well within the log4j.jar.  
Is this just a gliche with my download?  If not, there may be some backwards 
compatibility issues that have not been flaged correctly*.

creator: bugzilla@apache.org
text:
Steve,

RollingFileAppender is missing in log4j-core.jar not in log4j.jar. Please 
double check.

creator: seidensc@amfam.com
text:
The rolling file appender is missing from the log4j-core jar.  We were using 
the log4j-core jar from our Team Repository so that developer's would not see 
the errors associated with the full blown version of the source.  We can get 
around this by going back to the full version.  You might want to document this 
in history so that folks that have implemented the core jar aren't sidetracked 
like us.
